events.event_name: S&P Global Hong Kong SAR PMI Release (January 2026)
events.description: The release of the January 2026 PMI data showing an increase to 52.3.

facts.fact_text: The S&P Global Hong Kong SAR PMI increased to 52.3 in January 2026 from 51.9 in December.

evidences.evidence_text: The S&P Global Hong Kong SAR PMI increased to 52.3 in January 2026 from December’s 51.9

facts.fact_text: Foreign sales increased at the fastest pace since February 2023.

evidences.evidence_text: foreign sales increasing at the fastest pace since February 2023

facts.fact_text: Supplier performance improved for the second consecutive month.

evidences.evidence_text: supplier performance improved for the second month in a row

facts.fact_text: Employment in the private sector experienced a further reduction.

evidences.evidence_text: a further reduction in employment, although the pace of job shedding was only marginal

claims.claim_text: Business sentiment weakened to a five-month low due to US trade policy and market competition.
claims.author: S&P Global

evidences.evidence_text: Looking ahead, business sentiment weakened to a five-month low amid concerns over US trade policy and intense market competition.

claims.claim_text: Firms discounted prices to stimulate sales.
claims.author: S&P Global

evidences.evidence_text: output inflation accelerated modestly as firms discounted prices to stimulate sales

evidence.evidence_text: marking the fastest expansion in the private sector since March 2023, driven by a stronger rise in new business inflows
business sentiment weakened to a five-month low amid concerns over US trade policy
input costs rose due to higher raw material prices and staff costs
a further reduction in employment, although the pace of job shedding was only marginal
